faqs.question: How do I use the Eye Tracking Panel?
faqs.answer:
### Eye Tracking Panel Overview
The Eye Tracking Panel offers tools for setting up eye movement and blinking on your avatars, with support for both SDK3 and Legacy modes.

[image]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/catsblenderplugin/website/wikicurrent/eyetracking1.png[/image]

### Mode Selection
**SDK3 Mode**
- Simplified setup for VRChat SDK3
- Automatic bone rotation configuration
- Direct eye bone assignment

**Legacy Mode**
- Complete eye tracking setup
- Customizable eye movement
- Advanced blinking controls
- Shape key integration

### Eye Setup Controls
**Bone Selection**
- Head bone assignment
- Left/Right eye bones
- Automatic bone detection
- Smart bone hierarchy handling

**Shape Key Configuration**
- Wink left/right setup
- Lower lid controls
- Blinking animations
- Custom shape key mapping

### Testing Mode Features
**Eye Movement Testing**
- Real-time rotation preview
- X/Y axis controls
- Distance adjustment
- Reset position options

**Blinking Controls**
- Blink shape testing
- Lower lid animation
- Shape key verification
- Animation preview

### Additional Options
- Disable eye blinking
- Disable eye movement
- Eye distance adjustment
- Mesh selection for multi-mesh models

[note]Test your eye tracking setup thoroughly in VR to ensure natural movement and comfortable viewing angles.[/note]

[warning]For optimal results, ensure your model's eyes are properly weighted to their respective bones before setup.[/warning]
